PAN crashes when retrieving articles from a newsgroup

note.body:
I noticed pan crashing routinely when trying to load large groups.  I cloned the repository, built pan, and ran it under gdb.  Found that the function EvolutionDateMaker :: e_strftime_fix_am_pm in e-util.cc was entered with the parameter fmt NULL.  I added this one-line hack at the top of that function: 

if(!fmt) fmt = "%b %d %Y"; 

rebuilt, and the program is stable.  

The code is commit edad96df2858f5a586bd96a11ad20fca8e9165ec.  Since the bug seems related to locale, that reports as:
LANG=en_US.utf8
LC_CTYPE="C"
LC_NUMERIC="C"
LC_TIME="C"
LC_COLLATE="C"
LC_MONETARY="C"

LC_PAPER="C"

events.target_title: layout: Make the hot corner optional

note.body:
Is there a reliable way to obtain polling data about this matter? I think that no matter how many users report accidentally activating the hot corner, there still could be much more users who like it and consider it a part of GNOME 3 identity (like myself). In that case it would be reasonable to allow users to disable/enable it in settings/tweaks, but leave the corner activated by default since the majority of users prefer it.

Edit: I also think that default hot corner could be considered one of those design decisions that makes GNOME 3 stand out along other DE, though I could be biased towards it as well. Anyway, when you're making the final decision, there are a lot of strong points toward leaving it as default on previously mentioned reddit question.

note.body:
> In general, _better_ results would be preferable, because in the end you are only interested in one particular result.

@fmuellner But the problem is nearly a bug not a feature or personal request. 

I mean it is a huge problem for a end user to do not see the apps on dashboard search. so the end user will never able to start the app from search. the only way will be list all application and find the specific app.

If you ask for better solution: an option can be added to settings of gnome (or with gnome-tweak-tool, or on any config file to $HOME/.gnome) for search provider. Something like: "List all result", "list only 5 results" as true/false.

So the end user can decide whatever search provider will result.

Note: Listing all results does not mean that the resulting feature can not use the "rank/usage" feature. I mean search provider can sort apps by "usage". So the feature I want (I think it is not a feature but anyway :) ) will not break the better design for fast usage rules.


Thanks in advance

events.target_title: room: Add :channel-error property

note.body:
Just making sure I got everything right, in case I want to add a new property in any other typelib written in C.

src/lib/polari-room.h:

Here we just declare the two methods to be able to work with our new property.

src/lib/polari-room.c:

-simple declaration of channel_error as a cstring and then adding the new PROP enum.

-building the methods we declared in the .h, and basically returning the channel_error value or setting it to a given value (using the GObject typelib you mentioned in [issue 17](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/polari/issues/17))

-modifying the `polari_room_get_property` to include the new method created based on the new enum id of our property. Same goes for polari_room_set_property.

-last change : 
```
  props[PROP_CHANNEL_ERROR] =
    g_param_spec_string ("channel-error",
                         "Channel error",
                         "Channel error",
                         NULL,
                         G_PARAM_READWRITE | G_PARAM_EXPLICIT_NOTIFY);

```
I am not sure I understand what this one is for, but apparently we are adding some READWRITE and EXPLICIT_NOTIFY Flags to our property? Is this used in order to trigger the notify signal when we read or write the channel_error property?

Also, the creation of these methods means we will access the channel_error property using them , right?

Allow enter URL without scheme in component editor

note.body:
Hi @mcrha,

Thank you for getting back to me with a more civilised response than the initial respondent.  

Yes, It is what I was trying to convey ( apologies for any slight confusion) ... I was wondering if it would be possible to allow for the exclusion of the http/s: prefixes in text entry boxes, or as an alternative to ALSO ALLOW for "www." as a valid entry to call a website.  

**Scenarios**

a. **New > Calendar Appointment ** I add www.example.com address into the Description field of Calendar Entry Screen, click save & Evolution converts it into a live URL.  When the link is clicked, receive an error message box stating - **Could not open link , Operation Not Supported**

b. **New > Task** I opt to create a New Task... Enter www.example.com in the "Web Page" text entry field, along with other relevant details... Another link is also added into the Description Field.  Upon Save, Evolution converts both into live Web URLs... 

**When Description Field URL is clicked,** receive error message box stating **Could not open link , Operation Not Supported** 

**When Web Page Field URL is clicked,** receive error message box stating **Could not open link , The Specified Location is not supported** 

c. Perform both of the above tasks again, but insert http:// & https:// prefixes in the URLS, and links invoke the browser & load correctly.

It's fairly commonplace these days for many people not to utilise the http/s prefixes when typing a URL & a lot of websites don't event advertise their prefix - but by default - direct you to the secure site anyway.

If I am adding a Calendar Entry from details in an email, or document it would be more convenient & productive to just copy over the web address of a site into this field, without also having to add the prefix. The browser invoking the URL should be determining this information anyway.

Let me know your thought 

Kind Regards

Al

> Mmmmh wait. If you are using the Wayland session, why does gnome-control-center use X11 paths at all? Do you have `GDK_BACKEND=x11` somewhere in the environment? 

`echo $GDK_BACKEND` produces no output and neither does `env|grep GDK`.

> Seeing that the system is Gentoo, another possibility that crosses my mind is that gtk was not compiled with wayland support. 

GTK+ was compiled with Wayland support for sure.

events.target_title: Segmentation fault when selecting "Mouse & Touchpad" or "Wacom Tablet" in "Devices" tab.

note.body:
> Funky!
> 
> So effectively, gtk is compiled with Wayland support, and the crash happens because gnome-control-center uses the X11 paths *despite* of this. The crash happens when treating a GdkDevice that is actually created by the Wayland backend as a device created by the X11 backend.
> 
> This means it is gnome-control-center which is not built with Wayland support, completely explains all the things I wondered about.
> 
> The supporting code for wayland in gnome-control-center relies on libgudev, gnome-control-center 3.26.x used to autodetect the library at compile time to enable Wayland support.
> 
> I'd however advise to update to a more recent version if possible... 3.26.x is behind by 2 stable cycles, soon 3. In between, we switched to meson and made this a hard error unless `-Dwayland=false` is given, which would have made it a lot more evident :).

Gnome-control-center was actually compiled with Wayland support, but there was a Gentoo patch to enable building without Wayland support that caused this problem. I excluded the patch from the patchset, rebuilt gnome-control-center and now I can no longer reproduce the bug.

Thanks for the help!

note.body:
I'm up for implementing this, so consider me your newcomer :smile: 

I've had an initial look, and I'll keep on with that, but it appears a little different from what I expected; it doesn't seem that the full file paths of the dropped files are accessible via the drag and drop event. dataTransfer.files exists on the event but provides no mechanism I can see for accessing the full paths, and dataTransfer.items isn't available.

Unless I'm missing something that means we'd need to use the blob access via dataTranser.files, which isn't a major issue, but having a quick look at the way attachments are tracked (in ComposerWidget, etc) it doesn't appear to provide for attachments without a file.

I may also end up having a look at the image pasting from clipboard #304 so I imagine the capacity to add inline images from blobs will be useful, but I don't want to start down the wrong path.

Do the limitations I'm seeing sound sane? I am developing against the Flatpak runtime so I'm not sure whether that could be impacting things; I'm new to GNOME development.

I'm also on IRC (as creywood) if it's easier to discuss there

events.target_title: Inline images via drag and drop

note.body:
Thanks Michael!

Yeah I was seeing the same on MDN. I wasn't clear before though: `dataTransfer.files` is there, but the individual file objects don't expose the full path. For identification it seems only the filename (without path) is accessible, through `File.name`.

Curiously though I noticed that when the default handler remains active the full URI of the first file in the dropped set is added to the document. It's not clear to me whether whatever mechanism the default handler is using to get that URI is exposed (and if it were maybe the only get the first file?).

Presuming whatever the default handler is doing can't be used that might mean images dropped on the WebKit would need to work more like the clipboard behaviour you described.

Possibly stupid question, but might there be some other way to catch the drag and drop on a different "layer"? So it's not processed through the web component?

I'm historically at UTC+10 too, but we're currently doing a stint in at +1 in Europe.

push_data.commit_title: First changes for supporting drag & dropped and pasted images

events.target_title: Inline images via drag and drop

note.body:
Hey Mike,

I've made a first pass at making these changes [over here](https://gitlab.gnome.org/creywood/geary/commits/wip/90-304-image-dnd-paste).

It's a work in progress but it'd be great to get some feedback when you have a moment (.. after the release).

A few notes/questions:
- I've changed the `inline_files` and `cid_files` into `Memory.Buffer` instances but have left `attached_files` as `File` types for now. This was to get your feedback as also changing `attached_files` would mean changes through into `Geary.Attachment` (as a result of `ComposerWidget`'s use through `pending_attachments`), which I presume will impact a bunch of other things. One of the downsides to not making this change are not being able to handle non-image dropped files as normal attachments.
- The way I've used `get_uint8_array` to build the GMime part (in `RFC822.Message`) feels like there should be a better way..?
- I'm using a hash of current time to build a filename for pasted images. Happy to hear other ideas.
- Currently I'm attempting to accept any dropped image with an image mime type (`image/*`). Are you happy to go with that for now or should we attempt to restrict to a few standard types?
- The `blob://` URL scheme is required for dropping files into WebKit
- I've made some changes to `ComposedEmail.replace_inline_img_src` as the replaced term and search term can have the same length (which would have resulted in the previous test assuming and the replacement not succeeding). I do realise the updated approach is less performant (when the replacement succeeds).
- One minor usability issue I noticed is that when initially composing a new email the drop area for an inline image is pretty small as the WebKit view is only one line high

Also for #304.

Thanks!

Edit: typos

GVFS-SMB write problems to SMB2 shares

note.body:
>  Just a note that your `smb.conf` probably contains wrong parameters `min client protocol` resp. `max client protocol` as per the logs. It should be `client min protocol` resp. `client max protocol`. But this is probably irrelevant.

I think this may have actually been the source of my problem.  The logs didn't have it, but the setting for both those nonsense parameters was SMB3.  So, before doing the additional tests, I removed those lines from smb.conf, rebooted and now I can't recreate the problem anymore.  Just to be sure that change was the one that made the difference, I added the lines back, as they were, but I still can't replicate the problem.  Then I reformatted them correctly, rebooted and I couldn't connect to my SMB2 share (as expected).  After just removing those lines and rebooting one final time, I can no longer replicate the problem and after various tests writing to the GVFS share the issue no longer occurs in any way I can create.  

Thankfully, I have the traces and the logs to confirm that there actually WAS an issue earlier and that I'm not insane (well, I actually am, but for unrelated reasons :) ) but I can't find any way to recreate the issue which was so consistent a couple days ago.

So, I guess I'll just thank you for your time and close the issue.  If I can make it happen again, I'll re-gather the needed data plus the additional stuff you specified for a new bug.  I suppose this is the reason I was so eager to see if anyone else could replicate this.  :)

Thanks for your time,

Scott

The Chrome extension also called Authenticator at https://github.com/Authenticator-Extension/Authenticator uses another backup format shown below. it would be so nice if everybody were compatible at least for unencrypted exports and imports.

```
{
  "99999999999aaaaaaaaaaaaa99999aaa": {
    "account": "someusername",
    "counter": 0,
    "encrypted": false,
    "hash": "999999aaaaaaaaa9999999999bbbb999",
    "index": 31,
    "issuer": "example.com",
    "secret": "XEHXEXEXEXEXEXEXEHCFXEXEXEXEXEHKLSNXEXEXEXEXEH57XEHX",
    "type": "totp"
  },
 ...
}
```

events.target_title: Support FreeOTP+ backup/restore

note.body:
I am hereby proposing a standard unencrypted data exchange format that would be as simple as:

One otpauth URI per line.

This URI format is already standard (see: [https://github.com/google/google-authenticator/wiki/Key-Uri-Format](https://github.com/google/google-authenticator/wiki/Key-Uri-Format)). All the TOTP applications already know how to parse it. So, for data exchange output, simply write one otpauth URI per line to an output file. On input, read one line at a time and parse it as an otpauth URI.

At least one developer may be willing to go along with this if others do: [https://github.com/Authenticator-Extension/Authenticator/issues/282#issuecomment-464501532](https://github.com/Authenticator-Extension/Authenticator/issues/282#issuecomment-464501532).

Because I read, that Ubuntu LTS got an update to 18.04.**2** last Friday, so GLib probably was updated too, I repeated my last tests with Nautilus and an 8 GB file:

note.body:
Thanks for responding! My apologies for not including this information: I am running Evolution 3.31.4 on OpenSUSE Tumbleweed. However, to the best of my knowledge (based on my direct experimentation), even with the DConf setting you list in your comment, it is not possible to override the Space and Backspace keys (because of the code I quoted above); the DConf setting merely alters the behavior of the SMART_FORWARD and SMART_BACKWARD actions to only scroll up and down within the current message, but Space and BackSpace are still hard-coded as bound to those actions.

And yes, it does seem the GtkActions just steal the shortcut keystrokes whenever their associated component is active. E.g., the action I want to associate a shortcut with is "<Actions>/mail/mail-delete", and the associated keystroke seems to be grabbed regardless of whether the search entry is focused, because mail is active, but note that such a shortcut does not conflict with actions that have a prefix of "<Actions>/composer", nor does the "<Actions>/mail/mail-delete" shortcut fire when the composer is active. That observation leads me to wonder whether the searchbar could be promoted to be the same sort/level of component as mail and the composer, so that there could be "<Actions>/searchbar" actions and so that the "<Actions>/mail" actions would not fire when the searchbar is active. But that is purely speculation on my part; I don't really have any knowledge of how gtk+ accelerators work.

events.target_title: Isolate Layer
Isolate Layer

note.body:
Thank you for your script. 

I don't wish to appear ungrateful, but your script doesn't really fulfil the requirements as the "Isolate Layer" function as described in the feature request. It...

- makes a copy of the layer (preventing edits to the original layer without making the same opacity/mode adjustments)
- doesn't necessarily make the layer visible (the copied layer is placed just above the original layer, and so may be hidden by any other layers above).

However, it's a good starting point, and I believe I can use your script as a good way to jump into python and enhance it to behave as required.

Or, if you would like to improve it, what the script would need to to do is the following steps:

A) When "Isolate Layer" is activated...
1. For each layer (except groups), store the layer's current visibility.
2. For each layer (except groups), set visibility to "Hidden".
3. For the current layer, store the layer's Opacity & Blend Mode.
4. For the current layer, set the Opactiy to 100% and Blend Mode to "Normal"

The current layer would now be visible in a normal mode, and not hidden by any other layers, so editing is possible.  Then...

B) When "Isolate Layer" is deactivated...
1. Restore the current layer's Opacity & Blend mode from the previously-stored values.
2. Restore each layer's visibility to the previously-stored value.

The complexity I foresee is how to ensure "isolate layer" would work if the user selects a different layer before de-activating (and restoring all layers to their previous values). In Krita, once the "isolate" mode is selected, the user can flip between layers until "isolate mode" is deactivated.  Perhaps a way to simplify this would also be to prevent other layers from being selected while the user is operating in "isolate" mode, but even then they would have to activate/deactivate every time they wanted to change a layer, so... not as simple as it first appears!

note.body:
To @fmuellner:
>  Settings come with a cost, and "someone made wrong assumptions in a test suite" isn't a good justification IMHO.

I thought about this quite a lot and I would not say you can put all the blame on test developer. Actually window of that test has border decorations disabled through _MOTIF_WM_HINTS property (MWM_DECOR_BORDER [1]). I could argue that shadows around window borders are indeed border decorations (what else would they be?). And when program explicitly requests no border decorations, I don't think it is that crazy idea to expect no shadow around window's border.

Actually, shouldn't be shadow disabled for windows that request no border decorations?

To @halfline:
> have you considered writing a small extension that just sets the `shadow-mode` of all window actors to `Meta.ShadowMode.FORCED_OFF` 

I think It would be better if this problem could be solved without need for additional extensions.

> it's more a workaround for a buggy application or maybe a buggy mutter. but the workaround doesn't affect just the application it affects all applications. 

Actually who is buggy probably depends on point of view ( see higher ).


[1] http://www.ist.co.uk/motif/books/vol6A/ch-20.fm.html#963517

events.target_title: [RFE] Boxes could expose "advanced" preferences through VirtManager

note.body:
I am "just" a small user, but while i think Boxes does a pretty good job in setting good defaults (e.g. using virtio if possible), sometimes even us not so experienced users do need to use some deeper settings.

I understand the usecase of Boxes is for everything being dead simple, but IMHO sometimes then editing settings is needed, and when those settings are a bit hidded away, they dont confuse us users.
So while using defaults you are not exposed to a gazillion of settings, but when you need it they would be a click or 2 away.
IMHO that would be the optimal experience for us "normal" endusers.

Anyway, thanks for the hard work! I just switched to Linux some months ago, and things like Boxes amaze me again and again!
Kind regards

EDIT: I didnt said it directly, but i think somehow integrating virt-manager could serve that purpose well. And while for sysadminds, IMHO virt-manager is still accecible enough for those not so advanced users that like the ease of use of boxes, but sometimes do need more advanced settings.
It sounds like a pretty great thing IMHO: Managing my VMs + VNCs in the great and easy UI of Boxes, but to be able to tap into the power of virt-manager if i needed too!

I hope my english skills dont stand in the way to much so you can understand what i mean. Anyway, i dont want to mess up the bug tracker any more, so thanks again from a happy Linux newbie!

events.target_title: Initial support for being kicked.

note.body:
> When you are kicked from a room, does it remove the room from your room list?

The server sends that you have "left" the room. However, if that action was not performed by the user, it means they were forced out "kicked" by some other user. 

Basic strategy:
- Check last event in "left" room
- If event.user == user.id: All good, the room is "left". Rooms marked as Left don't appear on the UI
- If event.user != user.id: User was kicked: Mark the room as such. UI then sees this status and performs an action and then marks it as "Left"

> Can you still see the history from before you got kicked?

Currently, as far as I can tell from the UI, there is no way to see room history. ??? This just marks the room as left. 

> Could you join it again?

You can rejoin kicked rooms (they are simply rooms that are "left"), but not banned rooms. Banning might require a bit more work though. The implementation in QMatrix isn't as straightforward.

events.target_title: Initial support for being kicked.

note.body:
> also appop is going away

@jsparber: The only files that are necessary for this change are:
- `fractal-gtk/src/appop/room.rs`: Where UI happens
- `fractal-matrix-api/src/model/room.rs`: Backend support
- `fractal-gtk/res/.ui`: Actual dialog styling/etc.
- `fractal-gtk/src/uibuilder.rs` Dialog is created via builder

Where would the new UI be if not in appop? The main loop to check for rooms seems to be there.

> I think it would be better to show a inline message somewhere in the room history view because the dialog can be easily dismissed and it is unclear what's gonna happen with the room.

I agree. The dialog was suggested in #433, so I went that route. However, a sound and an inline would work well. I do see a problem:

- The way the app is implemented, room history is preserved but not implemented. (As far as I can tell)
- If the user was kicked from an invite-only room, they have no room history accessible.

events.target_title: SIGFPE with a GtkBox

note.body:
Add center child in an empty GtkBox does not crash.
A central placeholder does appear.
There was a warning sign, with this tooltip: "Property has versioning problems: Center Child".
This property has been [introduced in gtk-3.12](https://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/stable/GtkBox.html#gtk-box-set-center-widget).
Going to File>Properties, and changing Toolkit Version Required from 3.10 to 3.12 removes the warning.
But glade still crashes when checking "add center child" on a populated GtkBox.

As a workaround, it is possible to create a new GtkBox, add center child,
then drag and drop widgets into place.

Well, center child is not centered when the window expands... Giving up, not worth the trouble anyway.

events.target_title: GtkEntryCompletion and GtkComboBox only show top level nodes when using GtkTreeModelFilter

note.body:
Sometimes displaying the whole matching subtree would make sense.
Here is an example: https://stackoverflow.com/a/56047460/3565696.

When the given key matches a leaf, the whole branch should be shown
(important if several leaves may have the same name),
e.g. typing "dev" in the entry could yield
```
hamster
-> develop
geoptics
-> develop
```

When the given key matches a branch, the whole sub branch down to leaves should be shown, to allow selection of a specific leaf.
Typing "ham" could yield
```
hamster
-> admin
-> develop
```

events.target_title: GtkEntryCompletion and GtkComboBox only show top level nodes when using GtkTreeModelFilter

note.body:
If the "text_column" (the one that is looked for matches) should contain these strings, then a ListStore would be enough, wouldn't it ?

To clarify that it is *not* a matching issue, I also tried to use `set_match_func`, always returning `True`, and still only the toplevel showed up ("hamster" and "geoptics" in the example above).

Or is there some magic with slashes ?
(slashes do not match the existing [hamster](https://github.com/projecthamster/hamster) nomenclature: "activity@category") [*EDIT: tested, no, same behavior.*]

For a TreeStore, the current behavior is very surprising to me.

events.target_title: GtkEntryCompletion and GtkComboBox only show top level nodes when using GtkTreeModelFilter

note.body:
Thanks for the discussion.

> There seems to be some confusion/misunderstanding <...> search

Let's suppose that's a general comment, not directed at me. Because I did search, read documentation, look at the sources and experiment before posting here.

Following your points
1. Using GtkListStore is clearer, and that's my workaround for now.
2. A *separate* `TreeView` can be nice (I already linked to an [example](https://stackoverflow.com/a/56047460/3565696)). But it would be better to reuse the nice `EntryCompletion` TreeView popup/placement machinery.
Unfortunately the [`tree_view`](https://code.woboq.org/gtk/gtk/gtk/gtkentryprivate.h.html#_GtkEntryCompletionPrivate::tree_view) is private. Did I miss a way to access it ?
>>>
except for space restrictions or treestore selections within a Treeview renderer  
>>>
Space restrictions are a concern indeed. Could you please elaborate on the treestore   selections ?

3. Why impossible ? To me it is just a matter of number of lines.
For instance a TreeStore with 2 branches and 4 leaves per branch is still below the [about ten limit](https://developer.gnome.org/hig-book/unstable/controls-option-menus.html.en). That could fit well inside a ComboBox.  
And why "overlapping nodes" ?

My point is exactly that for TreeStore the default should be [expand_all()](https://lazka.github.io/pgi-docs/Gtk-3.0/classes/TreeView.html#Gtk.TreeView.expand_all)), using the match_func to select the lines to display.  
The current status prevents using the TreeStore altogether, since it is impossible to show any branch below top-level.

@albfan Please reopen ?

events.target_title: Fractal does not mark rooms as "read" when opening them
Fractal does not mark rooms as "read" when opening them

note.body:
One thing I noticed in my web server logs (I proxy via `lighttpd`) is certain requests from Fractal get a `411 Length Required` response, e.g. 
```
"POST /_matrix/client/r0/rooms/!zXfJBqSUvXySmsZMtB:jki.re/receipt/m.read/$1554944488956DCfEd:hveem.no?access_token=[redacted] HTTP/1.1" 411 357 "-" "reqwest/0.9.5"
```
While most requests get the usual 200 response.

events.target_title: Fractal does not mark rooms as "read" when opening them

note.body:
I tracked the issue down to the fact that `lighttpd` doesn't allow empty `POST`s without an associated `Content-Length` header set to zero. The attached patch fixes the issue for me, but I'm very new to Rust so I don't know if there's a better way to do this.

[fractal.patch](/uploads/ab7b9aa3c7ea0917760df4d831b3e1da/fractal.patch)

events.target_title: Fractal does not mark rooms as "read" when opening them

note.body:
Yes I think it has more to do with `lighttpd` being an unwise choice of reverse proxy than anything to do with matrix itself. That said my patch fixes the issue for me and I haven't noticed anything else breaking.

If there's a way to set the`Content-Length` header later on when we actually know the appropriate value I'd be happy to update my MR. Like I said I'm new to rust so I wasn't sure this was the best solution.

events.target_title: Re-enable controls for multiple monitors?
Re-enable controls for multiple monitors?

note.body:
Accepted that monitor configuration stability issue might not be in gnome.  In which case we go back to, can gnome better support people when their systems blip?

I'm in gnome 3.26.2.  Sorry I'm not more up to date, I've been busy.  

Btw I restarted the computer when this first happened, thinking this might force the settings back.  It didn't help.  It was only an extended dance in turning monitors off and on (and unplugging and re-plugging) so I could get at the options and moreover so that join persisted once there are 3 active monitors.

events.target_title: Re-enable controls for multiple monitors?

note.body: Wonderful, thanks for responding so fast!  Will also do as you suggest, and save that to re-do if I get this issue again.

note.body:
That's very strange. Clicking the link in Firefox downloads it for me. With wget, it comes through as a gzip-compressed iCalendar file:

```
$ wget --quiet -O - https://p33-calendars.icloud.com/holidays/us_en-us.ics | gunzip - | head
BEGIN:VCALENDAR
VERSION:2.0
PRODID:icalendar-ruby
CALSCALE:GREGORIAN
X-WR-CALNAME:US Holidays
X-APPLE-LANGUAGE:en-US
X-APPLE-REGION:US
BEGIN:VEVENT
DTSTAMP:20190531T224632Z
UID:c5bbb4ae-8dfd-33db-b3e0-4862c55e3ce7
```
